channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report E-2023110216
item.description:
Report E-2023110216

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-01
  • City: SCOTT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 1, 2023, two (2) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the concrete dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from OMI/E3 to remediate the impacted site. OMI/E3 deconstructed the pallet and removed two (2) 50 pound bags from the pallet. The crew collected the released material with and tools. OMI/E3 placed the released material and two (2) damaged bags into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023101407
item.description:
Report X-2023101407

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the trailer leaking. After clearing everyone out, the manager called for QA to check on package. QA got a red tote to clean up as well as some neutralizer to clear out the liquid that was on the truck. Some packages were affected by the hazmat, a IC package and two sets of tires. QA brought the hazmat, IC, and tires to hazmat cage to process properly. DescribePack: One can was damaged from the bottom of the can. It was noticeable leaking from a hole which damaged the other cans as well. The acid leaked through the box and the whole bottom of the package was gone. The shipper did not pack any inner packing to protect the products from getting damaged unacceptable when shipping out hazmats. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a red tote, put the lid on top of box and transported the hazmat to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023101364
item.description:
Report X-2023101364

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in unload by a package handler trainer and they place in a bin. Manager notified QA when they found it that the package is in unload. QA got a red tote, put the damaged hazmat box in tote and brought the tote to the hazmat area to be worked on. DescribePack: The package was leaking from the bottom and the corrosive liquid ate through the box. The liquid leaked because of the loose caps. The package had no inner packing to stop the items from getting damaged. Possibly the hazmat was turned over on its side is a possibility that it leaked as well. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a red tote, put the lid on top of box and transported the hazmat to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023101187
item.description:
Report X-2023101187

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tank car was seen by UPRR yard personnel to be leaking as it was being moved in the Reisor Yard in Shreveport LA. Haz Mat Manager Tom Robinson was called for a response. Mgr. Robinson called an emergency response contractor, and they got on site before he did. The car was leaking from a misaligned man way gasket and needed to be replaced. The gasket was replaced, and the man way was properly secured and the top and sides of the car wiped down so it could continue in transportation.

item.title: Report X-2023101088
item.description:
Report X-2023101088

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: SAINT ROSE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND WITH THE TOP OF THE BOX WET, UPON INSPECTION A LOOSE CAP WAS DISCOVERED AND PLACED IN HAZMAT CAGE AND THE PROPER HAZMAT PROTOCOL PROCEDURE WAS FOLLOWED. DescribePack: THE FAILURE WAS BECAUSE OF A LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE BOTTLES WHICH CAUSED LEAKAGE WHILE PACKAGE WAS BEING TRANSPORTED TO THE VANLINE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT BIN TO STOP THE SPREAD OF LEAKAGE TO ANY OTHER PACKAGE NEAR IT.

item.title: Report X-2023101060

Report X-2023101060

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged package was found by PM shift personnel and placed in red Hazmat tote then placed in Hazmat holding area for AM shift personnel to process. DescribePack: Plastic bucket was cracked on bottom. Crack goes across bottom of bucket. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged packaged was found by PM shift personnel and placed in red Hazmat tote then placed in Hazmat holding area for AM shift personnel to process.

item.title: Report X-2023101068
item.description:
Report X-2023101068

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found a little wet from the bottom by the manager in unload. The package was placed in a red tote and moved to the hazmat area. DescribePack: The package was wet from the bottles caps being loose and possibly turned over. The shipper barely put any inner packing inside to protect the bottles from getting damaged. When the bottles are leaning on its side it spills out so easily. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was in red tote immediately and transported the hazmat area so QA can process properly.

item.title: Report X-2023100986
item.description:
Report X-2023100986

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: CARENCRO
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The delivery driver coded package "06" Customer Refused/Damaged. Delivery driver brought package back to warehouse. Package was placed in yellow hazmat drum by PM personnel and left in QA processing area for AM personnel. The next morning package was inspected by morning shift personnel. Yellow drum was opened. Package was taken out, processed, placed in Blue Hazmat bag and placed back inside drum. DescribePack: Upon inspection discovered outer packing was wet and ripped. Discovered one gallon of coil cleaner had loose cap. 1 quart of Coil cleaner liquid leaked out into box and on all contents. The other 3 gallons of cleaner were dented. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside yellow hazmat drum and sealed by pm shift personnel to await processing the next morning.
